title: SEC to go with 9-game schedule starting in '26
content: The SEC said Thursday that it will go with a nine-game conference football schedule starting in 2026.

title: Jones: Offer to Parsons was richest for non-QB
content: Jerry Jones said the agreement he believed he made with Micah Parsons would have been the richest ever for a non-quarterback, adding, "Nobody has ever offered him more money than I have to play football. Period."

title: Sources: Kimbrel to Astros on major league deal
content: Veteran reliever Craig Kimbrel will add a fresh arm to the Astros' ailing bullpen as they try to hold on to their lead in the AL West.

title: Anthony makes mark in Bronx debut with key HR
content: Rookie Roman Anthony hit a two-run homer in the ninth inning and drove in three runs in a memorable Yankee Stadium debut as the Red Sox notched a 6-3 victory over the Yankees in the opener of a 4-game series Thursday night.

title: Tomlin: Steelers DT Harmon has sprained knee
content: Steelers first-round pick Derrick Harmon was carted off the field after sustaining a knee injury in the team's final preseason game against the Carolina Panthers on Thursday night.

title: Red-hot Aces rout Mercury, push win streak to 9
content: Led by A'ja Wilson's 19 points and 13 boards, the Aces rolled to their ninth straight victory Thursday night with an 83-61 win over the Mercury.

title: Source: Eagles WR Wilson sidelined for season
content: Eagles wide receiver Johnny Wilson will undergo season-ending knee and ankle surgery, a league source confirmed.

title: Father of Celtics' Brown arrested after stabbing
content: The father of Boston Celtics star Jaylen Brown was accused of attempted murder in connection with a stabbing Wednesday night in Las Vegas.

title: 📺 Yankees' Costanza bobblehead draws crowds
content: The bobblehead coincides with the New York Yankees hosting "Seinfeld Night" against the Boston Red Sox.

title: The best picks for each draft slot in Rounds 1 and 2 in 10-team leagues
content: Being prepared for anything gives you a leg up on draft day. We go through every slot to help you plan ahead and get off to a good start in your draft.

title: The NFL Enjoyment Index: How fun is your team to watch? We ranked all 32
content: Which NFL teams are must-watches every Sunday this season? We stacked all 32 by excitement, fun and intrigue, starting with Washington.

title: Projecting next year's QB market: Most likely scenarios and long shot possibilities
content: We picked teams with some level of QB1 uncertainty for 2026 and projected two potential outcomes for each.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Can anyone top this No. 1 team?
content: Baseball's top team is still rolling -- though might be slowing down -- while one NL contender continues its fall down our list in Week 21.

title: Real or Not, WNBA playoff race edition: Who’s in, who’s out and which teams will host
content: Which teams might host? Could New York fall to the 4-seed? We examine the teams in the WNBA playoff hunt.

title: Inside Brock Purdy's massive raise -- and the expectations for 2025 that follow
content: Purdy spent the offseason working on little things to improve his game after securing the biggest raise in NFL history.

title: An inside look at Jess Pegula and Jack Draper's first day of US Open mixed doubles
content: Before playing US Open mixed doubles together, Jess Pegula and Jack Draper had hardly spoken. Yet they pulled off two victories on Tuesday.

title: Vince Young's rise to college football legend began at Ohio State
content: Texas' 2005 title run started in Columbus, where Arch Manning and the Longhorns look to build a new legacy in '25.

title: 10 European storylines to follow: Liverpool and City rebuild, Barca's defense, more
content: Even with predictable title races, each season has its own personality and plotlines. So here are 10 fun plots we're particularly interested in following across Europe as 2025-26 kicks into gear.

title: 32 pick projections, eight months out: Yates’ early NFL mock draft of Round 1 has some surprises
content: Could Arch Manning go No. 1? Will QBs dominate the first round? Which teams could land playmakers? Field Yates projects next year's opening 32 picks.

title: How mid-major coaches are embracing -- or resisting -- being high-major launchpads
content: Some mid-major coaches lean into pitching their programs as a development step. Others are reluctant.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United's Højlund wants loan move
content: Rasmus Højlund is reportedly making it clear to the clubs linked to him that he wants a loan move. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Four-time champ Palou is IndyCar's 'talent of the century'
content: For some time, those in IndyCar have questioned just how talented Álex Palou. After sealing his fourth championship, that can no longer be a debate.

title: Watch: Shubhanshu Shukla shares timelapse video of 'Bharat from space'
content: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla shared a stunning timelapse video of India from the ISS, showcasing thunderstorms, the Himalayas, and a sunrise. He emphasized the mission's significance for India, expressing gratitude to all involved. ISRO highlighted the mission as a milestone, reflecting India's rapid advancements and global collaboration in space technology.

title: 'Maharaja tariffs': Trump trade adviser's fresh attack on India over Russian oil
content: Trump advisor Peter Navarro accused India of being a "laundromat for the Kremlin" by refining discounted Russian oil and selling it at premium prices, thus perpetuating the war in Ukraine. He defends US tariffs on Indian goods, citing unfair trade practices and the use of profits to buy Russian oil, ultimately funding Moscow's war efforts.

title: Watch: Babar Azam hits the nets following Asia Cup snub, video goes viral
content: Following his exclusion from Pakistan's Asia Cup 2025 squad and demotion in central contracts, Babar Azam is diligently working on his batting skills at the Ghani Institute of Cricket in Lahore. Selectors have omitted both Babar and Mohammad Rizwan from the upcoming tri-series and Asia Cup squad, opting for a team led by Salman Ali Agha.

title: TCS layoffs: IT employees union holds protests; company issues statement
content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) faces strong opposition from the Union of IT & ITES Employees (UNITE) over plans to lay off approximately 12,000 employees. UNITE, supported by CITU, is staging protests across cities, demanding the IT giant reverse its decision, alleging the move disproportionately affects experienced professionals.

title: OpenAI set to launch 1st office in Delhi, plans India debut
content: OpenAI is set to inaugurate its inaugural India office in New Delhi, marking a significant step in its commitment to the Indian market. Having already registered as a legal entity, the company is actively recruiting a local team to enhance AI accessibility across the nation.

title: Punjabi actor-comedian Jaswinder Bhalla, star of ‘Carry on Jatta’, passes away at 65
content: Veteran Punjabi actor and comedian Jaswinder Bhalla passed away at the age of 65 in a private hospital in Mohali on Friday morning after a brief illness. Bhalla, a celebrated figure in Punjabi cinema, was known for his impeccable comic timing and memorable roles in films like Carry on Jatta and Jatt & Juliet 2.

title: 'Friendship still very strong': Sachin Tendulkar continues to support Vinod Kambli
content: Sachin Tendulkar's enduring friendship with Vinod Kambli remains strong, as revealed by Kambli's brother, Virendra. Despite Kambli's recent health struggles, including a brain clot, Tendulkar consistently checks in on him and his wife. Virendra fondly remembers their close bond during Ranji Trophy matches.

title: Send back engineers: Beijing tells Foxconn; 300 staff recalled as iPhone 17 launch nears
content: Foxconn subsidiary Yuzhan Technology has recalled approximately 300 Chinese engineers from its India operations, marking the second such instance recently. This action follows reports that Beijing requested Foxconn chairman Young Liu to assess the company's Indian investments.

title: Elvish Yadav residence attack: Accused arrested; injured in shootout
content: Haryana police apprehended Ishant alias Ishu Gandhi, a prime suspect, after a dramatic shootout in Faridabad related to the firing outside Elvish Yadav's Gurugram residence. The Himanshu Bhau gang claimed responsibility, alleging Yadav promoted betting apps. Yadav reassured fans of his family's safety, expressing gratitude for their support.

title: Another Delhi school gets bomb threat mail: 4th such incident this week
content: A school in Dwarka Sector-7 received a bomb threat via email on Friday, prompting police and fire teams to respond. This incident follows a series of similar threats targeting Delhi schools in recent days.

title: Elon Musk teen prodigy quits after 2 years: Tech CEO respond; says ‘Never heard of him’
content: Elon Musk claims ignorance of Kairan Quazi's SpaceX departure, despite the 16-year-old prodigy's two-year tenure at the company. Quazi, who joined SpaceX at 14, is transitioning to Citadel Securities, citing a desire for faster-paced challenges in quantitative finance. He previously criticized LinkedIn for age-based restrictions, highlighting biases in opportunity gatekeeping.

title: Stock market: Nifty50 opens in red; BSE Sensex down over 100 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Friday following days of rally. While Nifty50 was still above 25,000, BSE Sensex dropped over 100 points.

title: 'He backs players he likes': Gautam Gambhir questioned over Shreyas Iyer snub
content: Sadagoppan Ramesh has ignited controversy by alleging that Gautam Gambhir didn't support Shreyas Iyer's Asia Cup inclusion, despite Iyer's stellar form, including a strong IPL and Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy performance. Ramesh also questioned the praise surrounding India's drawn Test series in England and highlighted Iyer's pivotal role in the Champions Trophy victory, where he was India's top scorer.

title: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta attack: Police detain friend of Sakariya Rajesh
content: Delhi Police have detained an associate of Rajesh Khimjibhai, the man accused of attacking Chief Minister Rekha Gupta. The associate, apprehended in Rajkot, Gujarat, allegedly transferred funds to Khimjibhai. Authorities are also investigating ten others linked to Khimjibhai through phone calls and online communications, suspecting a planned conspiracy behind the assault during a public hearing at Gupta's office.

title: Janel’s medical records surface; court seals filing in battle with Colker
content: A legal battle involving Janel Grant, Dr. Carlon Colker, and WWE took a turn when sensitive medical records were briefly exposed online. This occurred during Colker's defamation lawsuit against Grant's attorney, adding complexity to Grant's ongoing abuse and trafficking case against Vince McMahon and WWE. The court has since ordered the document sealed to protect Grant's privacy.

title: Tej Pratap Yadav says 5 families conspired to ruin his life; vows to expose them
content: Tej Pratap Yadav, expelled from RJD, alleges a conspiracy by five powerful families to ruin his political and personal life. He promises to expose them, claiming they were jealous of his popularity and colluded with BJP and RSS to tarnish his image. This follows his expulsion from RJD and the launch of his own political outfit.

title: Bastar man killed in Maoist ‘jan adalat’ for celebrating I-Day
content: In Bastar, a young villager, Manesh Nureti, was killed by Maoists for allegedly hoisting the national flag on their memorial and singing the national anthem with villagers and students. This act of defiance, celebrating Independence Day in a traditionally Red zone, angered Maoists who held a 'jan adalat' and sentenced Nureti to death in front of villagers.

title: Stephen A. Smith’s daughter admits Bryce James crush; dad reacts
content: Samantha Smith, daughter of Stephen A. Smith, made surprising revelations on his show. She confessed to having a crush on Bryce James a year ago. This happened before the feud between her father and LeBron James. Stephen was shocked by this. The discussion also covered Samantha's dating life. Stephen humorously referenced 'Bad Boys II' to express his protectiveness.

title: Rahul Dravid's dig at R Ashwin: 'Coaching Aussies? Mitchell Starc knows Tamil'
content: Rahul Dravid and Ravichandran Ashwin humorously revisited the 2023 Border-Gavaskar Trophy controversy, where Ashwin faced accusations of aiding Australia with spin techniques through a Tamil YouTube video. Dravid jokingly mentioned the criticism he received, suggesting Ashwin's coaching was perceived as superior. Ashwin defended himself, while recalling Mitchell Starc's playful reference to the video during the Indore Test.

title: Karnataka announces 50% concession on pending traffic e-challan fines
content: The Karnataka government has announced a 50% concession on penalties for pending traffic violation cases recorded through the Police Department’s mobile e-challan system. Effective from August 23 to September 12, this one-time offer aims to promote road safety and law-abiding behavior.

title: 'Hug and say sorry': Ahmedabad school reconciled students; teachers didn’t alert parents
content: The murder of Nayan Santani, a Class 10 student, was preceded by weeks of escalating clashes between him and his junior at Seventh Day Adventist Higher Secondary School. Despite teachers being aware of the hostility and attempting reconciliations, no strong action was taken, nor were parents informed.

title: Trump admin says reviewing all 55 million people with US visas for possible deportation
content: The US State Department is reviewing over 55 million visa holders. This is part of a broader vetting initiative. The aim is to identify grounds for visa revocation and deportation. The review includes social media and law enforcement records. It also includes violations of US laws. The department has revoked many visas since Trump's return.

title: After Ahmedabad, its Mahisagar: Student stabs peer in classroom spat
content: In Balasinor, Mahisagar district, a Class 8 student stabbed a classmate following a quarrel over who would exit a classroom first. The victim sustained injuries to his waist, abdomen, and shoulder and was hospitalized. Police investigation revealed the incident occurred after a recess scuffle where one boy punched the other. The accused then used a knife after school ended.

title: Colombia: At least 13 people dead, multiple injured in helicopter crash & bomb blast
content: Colombia experienced a surge of violence as a police helicopter was downed in Antioquia during a coca eradication operation, resulting in the death of eight officers. Simultaneously, a car bomb exploded outside a military aviation school in Cali, claiming five lives and injuring over thirty.

title: Cancer cure? New mRNA cancer vaccine wipes out tumors in mice; hope for universal treatment
content: University of Florida scientists have developed an experimental mRNA vaccine that successfully eliminated tumors in mice by supercharging the immune system. This innovative approach, unlike traditional vaccines, shows promise across multiple cancer types and enhances existing treatments. Researchers are optimistic about its potential as a "universal cancer vaccine," offering a new avenue in cancer treatment.

title: 'Time to rise': Dhanashree breaks silence on Chahal divorce
content: Indian cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal and Dhanashree Verma's marriage has officially ended, finalized on March 20, 2025, following an 18-month separation. A settlement of Rs 4.75 crore was reportedly paid by Chahal as alimony. Dhanashree, hinting at a fresh start, emphasized the importance of privacy and suggested she might share her perspective in the future, addressing speculation surrounding their relationship.

title: Monsoon session of Parliament washed out
content: The Monsoon session of Parliament concluded amid uproar. Opposition protests over Bihar electoral rolls review and Pahalgam attack disrupted proceedings. Speaker Om Birla expressed disappointment over the reduced productivity. The Lok Sabha functioned for only 30% of its time. The Rajya Sabha functioned for 39% of its time. Government's refusal to discuss Bihar SIR further fueled the conflict.

title: Russia’s biggest strikes on Ukraine: 500 drones, 40 missiles fired; US factory hit
content: A Russian missile hit an American factory in Mukachevo, Ukraine. The attack injured fifteen people. It was part of a large Russian airstrike. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the factory made household items. The strike occurred during US-led peace talks. Oleksandr Merezhko wants Ukraine to join NATO. Russia opposes Western military presence. Both countries have opposing views.

title: What Dharali & Chasoti disasters have in common
content: The contradiction has led scientists to suggest another possibility -- that these were glacial lake outburst floods, or GLOFs, disasters triggered when melting glaciers or fragile moraine dams gave way. The question matters. If rainfall was not the culprit, then the risks faced by mountain communities are even more unpredictable than assumed.

title: 'Coolie' Box Office Collection: Rajnikanth starrer beats Hrithik Roshan's 'War 2'
content: Rajinikanth's 'Coolie', directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, has grossed ₹229.75 crore after eight days, despite a slowdown after a strong opening. On its eighth day, the film earned ₹6.25 crore, narrowly missing the ₹230 crore mark. 'Coolie' stars Nagarjuna Akkineni, Soubin Shahir, Aamir Khan, Sathyaraj, Shruti Haasan, Upendra, and Rachita Ram. The film released on August 14, 2025.

title: ‘Game-changer?’: Dallas targets Wiggins in bold trade; Miami banks on depth
content: The Dallas Mavericks and Miami Heat are reportedly discussing a trade that would send Andrew Wiggins to Dallas. In exchange, Miami would receive Daniel Gafford, P.J. Washington, and a future first-round pick. This potential deal aims to reshape both teams, with Dallas seeking a championship piece and Miami prioritizing depth and future flexibility.

title: Beast mode ON! Rinku Singh hammers 108 off 48 before Asia Cup
content: Rinku Singh celebrated his Asia Cup selection by smashing a blistering 108 off 48 balls in the UPT20 League, leading Meerut Mavericks to a six-wicket victory over Gorakhpur Lions after they were struggling at 38/4. In another match, Karan Sharma and Abhishek Goswami's half-centuries propelled Kashi Rudras to an 88-run win against Noida Kings.

title: Pakistan SC grants bail to Imran Khan in May 9 cases, but ex-PM stays in jail
content: The top court’s order comes days after army chief Field Marshal Asim Munir’s remarks in Brussels stirred a storm back home. Munir was quoted as saying that Khan should “apologise for the May 9 violence, sit silently in Banigala (his residence in Islamabad), and let the present system complete its term”.

title: Whether President would seek SC opinion is her prerogative, says CJI
content: The constitution bench of CJI B R Gavai and Justices Surya Kant, Vikram Nath, P S Narasimha and A S Chandurkar appeared convinced by solicitor general Tushar Mehta's argument that the two-judge bench could not have used SC's Article 142 powers to step into the governor's shoes and grant deemed assent to 10 bills of Tamil Nadu.

title: Travis Kelce isn’t the first; Swifties dig up old clips — Taylor’s always flaunted her boyfriends
content: Taylor Swift's romance with Travis Kelce grabs attention. However, she has always been open about her relationships. Public displays of affection were common with Harry Styles and Calvin Harris. The Joe Alwyn era was an exception. Now, dating an NFL star amplifies visibility. The audience has doubled. Coverage happens live on sports broadcasts. Kelce matches Swift's energy.

title: Stephen Curry’s flirty message to Ayesha resurfaces; actress recalls moment
content: Ayesha Curry recently shared the charming story of how her relationship with Stephen Curry began. The couple initially met as teenagers but reconnected later when Stephen spotted Ayesha in a Yung Berg music video. His first message to her was a casual Facebook inquiry about whether she still lived in Los Angeles.

title: Undertaker joins Bigg Boss 19; WWE icon stuns fans
content: Wrestling icon The Undertaker is reportedly in negotiations to appear on 'Bigg Boss' season 19 as a wild card entry. Hosted by Salman Khan, the WWE legend's potential week-long stay has sparked speculation about his salary. Following in the footsteps of The Great Khali, Undertaker could become one of the highest-paid contestants ever.

title: 'War 2' Box Office collection: Film crosses Rs 200 crore mark in India
content: Ayan Mukerji's 'War 2,' starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR, has crossed Rs 200 crore in India within eight days, despite clashing with Rajinikanth’s 'Coolie'. The spy thriller, part of a growing universe, saw mixed occupancy after a strong opening weekend. 'Coolie' currently leads at the box office, surpassing 'War 2' in total collections.

title: UP Woman Killed By Village Head For Refusing To Marry, Body Chopped Into Pieces
content: A former village head and his nephew were on Wednesday arrested in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi for the murder of a woman, chopping her body parts and throwing them at various places, a senior official said.

title: "Trump 2028" Caps At White House Merch Room Teases 3rd Term Re-run
content: US President Donald Trump was recently seen showing off "Trump 2028" caps to foreign leaders at the White House, in a series of acts that have left his supporters confused whether he would, or not, contest for a third term.

title: NRI Industrialist Lord Swraj Paul, Founder Of Caparo Group, Dies At 94 In London
content: Leading NRI industrialist Lord Swraj Paul passed away in London on Thursday evening, family sources said. He was 94.

title: Students Evacuated After Delhi's Dwarka School Receives Bomb Threat Via E-mail
content: Maxfort School in Delhi's Dwarka was evacuated on Friday morning after it received a bomb threat via e-mail, officials said.

title: OpenAI To Launch First India Office In Delhi This Year, Begins Hiring: Report
content: ChatGPT parent OpenAI will open its first India office in New Delhi later this year, deepening its push in its second-largest market by user numbers.

title: Delhi Chief Minister Attack: Man Detained Over Money Transfer To Accused
content: As the investigation into the attack on Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta continues, police have detained a friend of the accused, Rajesh Khimji, from Rajkot.

title: "Maharaja In Tariff": Trump's Trade Advisor Attacks India Over Russian Oil
content: Calling India the "Maharaja" of tariffs, US President Donald Trump's trade adviser, Peter Navarro, accused New Delhi of running a "profiteering scheme" by continuing to import Russian oil.

title: Fresh Trouble For Congress MLA As Trans Woman Says He Wanted To 'Rape' Her
content: Kerala Congress MLA Rahul Mamkootathil, who faces allegations of sexual harassment, found himself in fresh trouble after a trans woman activist accused him of sending her "sexually regressive messages".

title: Mega Mumbai Crackdown Against App-Based Cabs Over Surge Pricing During Rain
content: Cab fares often shoot up when it rains. The scenario wasn't any different during the recent rain that submerged Mumbai. This time, it drew strict action from authorities.

title: Prince William's New Home Sparks Doubts Over Buckingham Palace's Future
content: Britain's future king Prince William and his family are moving to a new home on the royal Windsor estate, prompting uncertainty about the future of Buckingham Palace.

title: With Bengal Polls Looming, Trinamool Leads Opposition Charge In Parliament
content: As the Monsoon Session of Parliament wound down on Thursday, one party stood out for its relentless aggression - Mamata Banerjee's Trinamool Congress.

title: Satish Golcha, Known For 2020 Delhi Riots Response, Takes Charge As Police Chief
content: Senior IPS officer Satish Golcha was appointed the 26th Commissioner of Delhi Police on Thursday, succeeding SBK Singh, who held the post for just 21 days.

title: Assam Man, Who Killed Woman For Refusing To Marry Him, Sentenced To Death
content: A court in Assam's Dhemaji on Thursday sentenced a man to death for the brutal murder of a college student in 2021. According to officials, the man had killed the woman for refusing his marriage proposal.

title: Erik Menendez, Accused Of Killing Parents With His Brother, Denied Parole
content: Erik Menendez was denied parole Thursday after serving decades in prison for murdering his parents with his older brother in 1989.

title: Man Who Shot At Elvish Yadav's Gurugram House Arrested In Police Encounter
content: The accused, identified as Ishant alias Ishu Gandhi, fired more than half a dozen rounds at the Faridabad Crime Branch team with an automatic pistol.

title: Russia Scrutinises Online Behavior, Bans "Extremist" Content
content: Just like his peers, Russian teenager Artyom spends "half his life" online -- something that could soon become risky as a ban on searching for "extremist" content comes into force.

title: Brazil Passes Law Expanding Social Media Protections For Minors
content: Brazil's lower house approved legislation on Wednesday expanding requirements for digital platforms to protect minors, after a prominent social media influencer allegedly sexually exploited a child.

title: Tej Pratap Claims Political Conspiracy, Vows To "Expose" 5 Families Today
content: RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav's elder son Tej Pratap Yadav has once again claimed that five powerful families conspired to "destroy" his political and family life.

title: Ukrainian Firm Develops Long Range Missiles, Drones To Attack Russia
content: When a Ukrainian-made drone attacked an ammunition depot in Russia last September, it showcased Kyiv's determination to strike deep behind enemy lines and the prowess of its defense industry.

title: Five things to watch in NCAA women's volleyball this season
content: Nebraska, Penn State, Pitt and Louisville are the top four ranked teams as the 2025 volleyball season opens.

title: AFC South betting preview: Texans favored; will Colts, Jags, Titans beat expectations?
content: Is it the Texans' division to lose, or will another team step up? Here are all the odds for each team in the AFC South and our favorite bets.

title: Exclusive | ICC Women's World Cup: Cops set tough terms for KSCA to host matches
content: The Karnataka State Cricket Association's hopes of hosting ICC Women's World Cup matches at M Chinnaswamy Stadium are in jeopardy as the police department has issued 17 requirements following the deadly stampede during the IPL victory celebrations on June 4 that left 11 dead. These requirements address concerns about parking, medical facilities, fire safety, women's safety, and security measures.

title: Record demand for over 45 lakh saplings at Koppal Horticulture Fair
content: Ninth edition of the annual fair attracted over 10,000 farmers and visitors from Koppal and neighbouring districts

title: Odisha to appoint 45,000 primary school teachers over next three years
content: All students studying Class IX and X will be covered by free textbook supply programme, which as of now, was limited to Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe students only

title: Karnataka High Court comes to aide of age-barred widow to get job on compassionate grounds in NWKRTC
content: The court considered it as a special case as Lakshmavva of Gadag, who had lost her husband who was employed in NWKRTC, had no means to earn a livelihood. The couple have no children, who could have been considered for appointment instead of her as she had crossed the age limit for the post.

title: Anganwadi workers stage protest against facial recognition system for ICDS beneficiaries in Kalaburagi
content: They argued that the FRS, which requires beneficiaries’ facial data to be scanned before distribution of foodgrains and nutritional supplements, violates the spirit of the National Food Security Act, 2013, whose core objective is to ensure that no individual goes hungry

title: Madras and the world: a package
content: This is a compilation of stories authored by writer and historian V. Sriram, published in The Hindu on August 22, 2025 on the occasion of the 387th Madras Day

title: Veteran Punjabi comedian Jaswinder Bhalla dies at 65
content: Renowned Punjabi actor Jaswinder Bhalla dies at 65 after brief illness, known for roles in popular Punjabi films

title: The link between Madras and the Far East
content: The history and legends of the Pallavas and Cholas would be incomplete without the mention of their exploits in the Far East. In this way, Madras and the Far East share a connection that spans centuries — something that has weathered the colonial era and has been thriving on multiple fronts in contemporary times

title: Shooter wanted for firing outside Youtuber Elvish Yadav’s Gurugram house arrested after encounter
content: The shooter, Ishant Gandhi sustained a bullet injury in his leg in a retaliatory firing by the police during the encounter

title: Supreme Court to shortly pronounce verdict on capture and relocation of stray dogs | LIVE
content: A Bench led by Justice Vikram Nath will decide whether the apex court’s earlier suo motu directive mandating the confinement of strays should be suspended or allowed to operate

title: The impact of the Swiss, the Finns and the Swedes in Madras
content: Starting out ecclesiastically, Sweden’s interaction with Madras later took a turn for the industrial, with the flourishing typewriter factory on Halda Junction and the WORTH Trust, which started out as a workshop rehabilitating people with leprosy. The latter still exists, and has since expanded its scope to other disabilities. Meanwhile, the Swiss had a hand in one of Chennai’s most iconic landmarks, the Integral Coach Factory

title: Tracing the Russian influence in Chennai’s history
content: Madras’ tryst with communism goes back to the early 20th century, but the Theosophical Society, co-founded by Madame Blavatsky, was when things really kicked off. Following this, the city’s ties with the erstwhile U.S.S.R. only deepened, with even a visit from Nikita Kruschev and Nikolai Bulganin in 1955. Today, the Heavy Vehicles Factory in Avadi and the Russian Cultural Centre are but two of the many connections that persist

title: ‘Maharaj’ in tariffs: White House Trade Adviser Navarro criticises India over Russian oil
content: Mr. Navarro’s comments came on a day External Affairs Minister Jaishankar responded to criticism of India by American officials for its energy ties with Russia

title: How women migrant electors are disenfranchised in the Bihar SIR process | Explained
content: The Election Commission which has highlighted the ‘frequent migration of population from one place to another’ as a justification for the ‘intensive verification drive’ fails to mention marriage, which is the most common ground for female migration in India

title: Evolution of the Japanese ties in Madras
content: To say Madras and Japan got off to a rocky start would be an understatement. A few decades later, however, a new respect for Japan emerged, based on their emphasis on quality and production processes. By the time liberalisation rolled around, Chennai companies were well poised to deal with the world thanks to the quality initiatives imparted by the Japanese

title: When Malayalam cinema romanced Anna Flyover
content: The Anna Flyover was a familiar landmark in the Malayalam films of the ’80s and ’90s. Earlier known as Gemini Flyover, it often appeared as an establishing shot or setting for tense scenes

title: The very old American bond with Madras
content: Madras’ association with the U.S.A. predates even the time when the latter came to be known as such. During colonial times, a few Americans held the post of the city’s consular agent, one of them even appointed by none other than George Washington. During WWII, British and American troops poured into Madras harbour, and two among them ended up leaving behind valuable records, in the form of photographs, of everyday life in the city’s past

title: On Boat Mail, Sinhala films and the Sri Lankan connect in Madras
content: Relations with Sri Lanka, Madras’ closest foreign neighbour, have had their ups and downs. On the cultural front, scholars and saints from both lands shared a healthy rapport. Then, there was the Boat Mail. Exchanges in the arts also flourished, but tumultuous times soon came calling. As peace settles in once again, a new chapter of tourism and trade unfolds

title: Land of hope and despair: crop failure and rising debts push farmers to suicides in Andhra
content: Crop failure and rising debts are forcing many tenant farmers in Palnadu district to end their lives. Most of their kin are yet to receive the ex gratia offered by the government and many deaths are yet make it into records, writes Nellore Sravani

title: Hyderabad electrocution deaths: Where wires hang low, and accountability even lower
content: Hyderabad’s recent spate of electrocution deaths — eight lives lost in just two days — has exposed not just frayed wires but a frayed system. Safety audits are allegedly ignored, court orders remain on paper and temporary fixes pass for reforms. Power lines cut across multiple agencies, yet none claim full responsibility. Naveen Kumar and Lavpreet Kaur uncover how the city’s electrical grid is more than a mess of dangling wires

title: CPI(M) puts the onus on the Congress to decide whether Mamkootathil should resign as MLA
content: Party State Secretary M.V. Govindan says Mamkootathil’s resignation as Youth Congress State president seems too little. “The act of tokenism does not rest the serious charges against  Mamkootathil,” he says

title: The French connection in Madras
content: Between Alliance Française and Saint Gobain, the French presence in modern-day Chennai is fairly apparent. But turn  time back and one will realise that the French ruled Madras for a very short three years and did not leave behind anything of note. All this, thanks to their historical rivalry with the British and the Treaty of Aix-Le-Chapelle

title: Kupwara custodial torture case: CBI to press for police remand of 8 including two police officers
content: It comes a day after the central investigating agency arrested six policemen, including a Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP)-rank officer, and two civilians in the case

title: The Danish imprints in the history of Madras
content: The story of how Tamil became the first language to be printed in the country involved both the Danes and Germans. While printing operations eventually shifted to Vepery in Madras, the Danish eventually faded as colonialists in the region. Cut to the present, however, the Danes still very much have a strong connect with Chennai

title: A dog’s life in Bengaluru
content: Animal Birth Control, microchipping, and feeding programmes form part of the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike’s plan to strengthen co-existence of humans and dogs in the city. But activists are not on board with all of them, writes Chetan B.C.

title: Study finds high cancer incidence among women in Jaipur’s polluted area
content: The surface water bodies in Sanganer town have a high pollution level with the toxic effluents coming from the textile and other units

title: New book on judicial impeachment revisits ‘corruption’ controversy around former Calcutta HC judge Soumitra Sen
content: The book was launched in Kolkata last week, at a time when Justice Yashwant Varma of the Allahabad High Court faces the possibility of impeachment after the recovery of wads of cash from his official residence

title: NHRC issues notice to Uttar Pradesh goverment over patient’s death at Kanpur Medical College
content: A patient’s death was noticed and the body was moved to the mortuary after several hours when other patients starting leaving the ward due to foul smell

title: The German influence in Madras
content: Long before a German warship came calling in 1914, there was always the odd German in Madras. Much later in 1959, West Germany assisted in setting up the institute that would go on to become IIT-M, while in 2007, BMW helped make Chennai an automobile hub. On the cultural front, the Max Mueller Bhavan Goethe Institut has been an enduring fixture in the city since its establishment in 1960

title: Central govt. official duped of ₹31 lakh by ‘currency market investor’
content: Allegedly, the accused approached the senior government official in July 2023 with an offer — invest ₹25 lakh and receive double the amount within a year

title: The legacy of the Armenians in Chennai
content: Madras seems to have recorded its first Armenians from the 1660s. Even today markers of their lives can be found all across the city, and among all the foreigners who came here, the Armenians are perhaps remembered with the greatest fondness

title: How Kerala’s youngsters are stepping up as palliative caregivers
content: Across the State, students are training to offer support and comfort to the aged and terminally ill, fostering a culture of care

title: How the Portuguese shaped Madras
content: The Portuguese arrived in Madras sometime in the 16th Century, and they were the first among the significant colonial presences in the region. From sprawling monuments such as Luz Church and enduring street names such as DeMonte to often-used loan words, they have left an indelible mark on the city

title: A touch of Dutch in Chennai
content: While the British were still struggling to find a foothold in Madras in 1639, the Dutch were well-established at Pazhaverkadu aka Pulicat, 60 km north of Madras. While there is very little of Dutch heritage left in these parts, the vestiges that have endured still serve to paint a striking picture of days long past

title: Ban on CPI (Maoist) and its affiliated outfits extended by one year
content: The government has also imposed a ban for one year on the frontal organisations of the CPI (Maoist) such as the All India Revolutionary Students’ Federation (AIRSF), Gramina Pedala Sangham (GPS

title: Address concerns of farmers, workers on priority, demands CPI(M)
content: The party opposes land allocation to LuLu Group, forcible installation of smart meters, and additional power tariff burden, says State secretary Srinivasa Rao

title: Ganesh pandals: apply for police permission on ganeshutsav.net, says DGP
content: The online system was launched to facilitate the celebrations in a peaceful, transparent, and secure manner

title: AP Maritime Board and APM Terminals sign pact for development of seaports in Andhra Pradesh
content: As per the agreement, APM Terminals will create infrastructure such as modern terminals and cargo handling facilities, and manage the upcoming Ramayapatnam, Machilipatnam, and Mulapeta seaports

title: Be on your best behaviour or face action, Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu warns MLAs
content: He is said to have conveyed his displeasure against certain MLAs to the district in-charge Ministers

title: Speaker’s constituency gets ₹240 cr, but no funds to others, says Sunil Kumar
content: Intervening, Mr. Khader justified the funds provided by the Public Works Department (PWD) for taking up road works in his constituency

title: On Madras dealing with the Chinese
content: Though the relationship between India and its neighbour China has been an uneasy one for decades, the latter’s link to the subcontinent’s southern region is replete with interesting tales — be it the legend of Bodhidharma, the travels of Xuanzang, or the trade that flourished during Pallava and Chola times

title: Calcutta HC division bench refuses to interfere with single-judge WBJEE result order
content: A single judge bench of the Calcutta High Court had earlier directed the WBJEE board to “recast the merit list and publish a fresh panel with 7% reservation for 66 classes of OBC candidates as recognized by the West Bengal Backward Classes Department prior to 2010”

title: Chennai: A coastal hub of international trade since ancient times
content: While Madras’ documented history only goes as far back as 1639, accounts found in Bhakti poetry may give us a glimpse into the region’s distant past — corals and pearls washed ashore on the beach in Tiruvallikeni, elephants being offloaded in Mayilai, and a flourishing trading hub in Tiruvottriyur

title: FAIMA launches toll-free mental health helpline for doctors across India
content: The initiative, led by Maharashtra doctors Dr. Sajal Bansal from Nagpur and Dr. Akshay Dongardive, FAIMA’s president from Mumbai’s Nair Hospital, involves 50 psychiatrists and offers free assistance 20 hours a day.

title: Punjab Finance Minister Cheema criticises Centre’s GST rate rationalisation, terms it ‘irresponsible’
content: Mr. Cheema said that since the implementation of GST in 2017, Punjab has suffered a total financial loss of ₹1,11,045 crore

title: PWD takes possession of disputed Imambara in M.P.’s Dhar; heavy force deployed
content: Dhar Superintendent of Police (SP) Manoj Kumar Singh told The Hindu multi-layered security arrangements remain in place given the sensitivity of the matter

title: Samajwadi Party didn’t stand with Hindus in communal riots: Yogi Adityanath
content: Speaking at a public meeting in Aligarh to mark Kalyan Singh’s death anniversary, the Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister used the Hindutva icon’s backward caste credentials to attack the PDA politics of the Opposition

title: Voter roll row: W.B. govt. complies with poll body directive, suspends 4 officials
content: The State government, however, has refused to file FIR against the officials as directed by the Election Commission

title: Child rights panel seeks report after class 10 student stabbed in Ahmedabad
content: The Chairperson of the State Child Rights Commission said, “we have asked the school to submit a report about the incident. We will take action based on the report”

title: Tamil Nadu among States tough on drug trade: DGP Shankar Jiwal
content: ‘While drug consumption in the State is among the lowest in India, confiscation is high, which is proof that Tamil Nadu is proactive in cracking down on drug trade, and is a victim State fighting against drugs coming from other States’

title: 35,000 property owners in Bengaluru are ready to manage solid waste on their premises: DKS
content: The Deputy Chief Minister said that the garbage management in the city was “controlled by mafia”, which did not allow floating of tenders

title: Cloudburst or glacial lake outburst: J&K govt. yet to identify what caused Kishtwar nature’s fury
content: Chief Minister Omar Abdullah, who chaired a meeting to review the ongoing relief and rehabilitation measures, underlined that the real cause is still unknown

title: Indian Council of Social Science Research issues show cause notice to CSDS for ‘maligning ECI’, alleges ‘administrative, financial irregularities’
content: ICSSR asks CSDS why its Grant-in-Aid, which reportedly covers 90% of staff salaries and 50% of administrative costs, should not be cancelled; CSDS study on Bihar SIR exercise listed as “major irregularity”

title: The weight of being a mango man: on mango farming in Uttar Pradesh
content: In Saharanpur, Uttar Pradesh’s second-largest mango producing district, farmers face multiple issues: instability in prices after COVID-19 lockdowns, overuse of pesticides and plant growth regulators that diminish the quality of fruits, and the control of middlemen over the market, finds A.M. Jigeesh

title: SpaceX took oxygen leak before Axiom-4 launch ‘lightly’: ISRO Chairman
content: Insistence on full-fledged test following leak in oxidiser line of the rocket prevented “catastrophic failure” of Axiom-4 mission that carried Shubhanshu Shukla to space, says ISRO Chairman V. Narayanan

title: Former student held after attack on teacher in Madhya Pradesh’s Narsingpur
content: There was an argument between the youth and the woman teacher after he allegedly passed comments on the teacher’s attire on Independence Day this year. The teacher is now stable

title: Defence Minister meets Shubhanshu Shukla, says his journey will motivate young people
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said they discussed Group Captain Shukla’s space mission, his experiments onboard the ISS, technological advances, and the road ahead with India’s upcoming Gaganyaan mission

title: Nitish refuses wear skull cap at madrasa event in Patna
content: A video of the Bihar CM placing the cap on the head of his Cabinet colleague and Minority Welfare Minister Mohammad Zama Khan gained traction on social media

title: Ensure universal registration of births and deaths, RGI tells States
content: Hospitals have to report the event within 21 days, says RGI; in March, RGI said that 10% births were not getting registered in the country

title: Birla, Harivansh flag poor productivity, slam Opposition for disruptions as Monsoon Session ends
content: The Upper House functioned for only 41 hours and 15 minutes, while the Lok Sabha could work only for 37 hours this session.  In their concluding remarks, Mr. Birla and Mr. Harivansh criticised the Opposition members for their behaviour

title: Bihar SIR:  Notices issued informing voters that Aadhaar can be submitted with claims, Election Commission of India informs Supreme Court
content: The poll panel says list of names and details of 65 lakh electors not included in draft roll published on August 1 has been posted on websites of all 38 District Electoral Officers in Bihar

title: PM expresses disappointment over Opposition’s absence from debates over crucial Bills
content: Modi says bright and young MPs of Congress did not get to participate in discussions due to the “insecurity” of its leadership

title: Karnataka Transport Department collects over ₹82 lakh fine from errant auto-rickshaw drivers in four months
content: The crackdown, carried out between April and July 2025, came after commuters lodged a spate of complaints about drivers fleecing passengers, refusing rides, and causing harassment

title: Silence will only embolden the bully: Chinese Ambassador on U.S. tariffs
content: Possibly setting the tone for the upcoming SCO Summit in Tianjin, Chinese Ambassador to India Xu Feihong said China stands with India and blamed the U.S., which he called a “bully”, for “using tariffs as a bargaining chip to demand exorbitant prices”

title: Srinagar’s Dal Lake hosts first-ever Khelo India water games with eyes on talent for Olympics
content: At least 409 athletes from 36 States and Union Territories (U.T.s) are participating in the water sports events, competing for 24 gold medals over the next three days

title: Maoists kill villager in Chhattisgarh’s Kanker district

title: Supreme Court to pronounce verdict on plea challenging removal of stray dogs from streets of Delhi NCR

title: Should Supreme Court sit powerless as Governors block bills: CJI

title: Palaniswami trains guns on Vijay
content: Just as one could not always debut as a hero in films, a political newcomer could not expect to shine in politics immediately, says AIADMK leader

title: Parliament Monsoon session: Lok Sabha passed 12 bills, Rajya Sabha 14 amid Opposition protests

title: UFC Fight Night: Expert picks, best bets for Johnny Walker vs. Zhang Mingyang

content: a lot has changed since the last time we ranked the top MLB prospects . some of the prospects in our ranking are in different places after a busy trade deadline . this is my ranking of these players for the long term, considering their upside, risk and proximity to the big leagues .

title: Draft Guide: Rankings, mock drafts and analysis
content: this draft guide will serve as one-stop shop for all of our best fantasy football picks possible in every draft you're in . we have everything needed to help you draft a great team and start the season with a shot . it doesn't matter whether you have been doing this for years or are a first-timer .

title: NFL preseason Week 3 takeaways: Will Giants' Tommy DeVito make the cut?
content: the third week of the 2025 preseason kicks off on friday . teams take their final look at key position battles ahead of deadline to trim rosters to 53 players . some bottom-of-the-roster spots seem to have been secured Thursday night .

title: Did Broncos win Devaughn Vele trade? Grading offseason trades
content: the bulk of the offseason might be over, but NFL teams still can mold their rosters between now and week 1 . there are still weaknesses to shore up, players whom teams want to move on from and looming contracts to be settled . the Dolphins traded cornerback Jalen Ramsey and tight end Jonnu Smith to the Steelers for safety Minkah Fitzpatrick .
